name: bergman5
probTex: Recall $K(z,z)>0$ on any bounded domain. Thus $\ln K(z,z)$ makes sense. Specifically for the disc, compute\n\[\frac{d^2}{dzd\overline z}\ln K(z,z).\]\nRecall that $\frac{d}{dz}=\frac{1}{2}\left(\frac{d}{dx}+i\frac{d}{dy}\right)$ and that $\frac{d}{d\overline z}=\frac{1}{2}\left(\frac{d}{dx}-i\frac{d}{dy}\right)$.
solnTex:
We computed $K(z,z)$ on the disc to be
\[K(z,z)= rac{1}{\pi\left(1-|z|^2ight)^2}= rac{1}{\pi}\left(1-z\overline zight)^{-2}.\]
Then
\[\ln K(z,z)=-\ln\pi-2\ln(1-z\overline z).\]
Taking $ rac{d}{dz}$ of this gives
\[2 rac{\overline z}{1-z\overline z}.\]
Taking $ rac{d}{d\overline z}$ of this gives
\[2 rac{1-z\overline z+z\overline z}{\left(1-z\overline zight)^2}= rac{2}{\left(1-|z|^2ight)^2}.\]
